intro: Geniostoma hallei var. hivaoense, commonly known as the Hivaoa geniostoma, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
